serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
United States State Plane Zones (NAD 1983) represents the State Plane Coordinate System (SPCS) Zones for the 1983 North American Datum within United States.
Several State Plane Coordinate System zones are not shown in this dataset, including Puerto Rico, the U.S. Virgin Islands, American Samoa, Guam, and Louisiana's offshore zone.
This dataset is a part of the 2008 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: United States State Plane Zones (NAD 1983) is generalized and an approximation of the actual State Plane Coordinate System zone boundaries for the 1983 North American Datum. It is intended for visual reference at small and medium map scales. Please check with state authorities if you have a question about a zone boundary.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:5,000,000.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.706

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry. The data set boundaries are approximations of the actual State Plane Coordinate System zone boundaries.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The horizontal positional accuracy is unknown.

citeinfo.title: ArcData Online GIS Data on the Web U.S. State Plane Zones Data Set

procstep.procdesc:
This data set was created from several sources: Extracted state boundaries from ArcUSA 1:25M. Created state plane boundaries based the map, "Index of State Plane Coordinate (SPC) Zone Codes (NAD 1983)" dated 12/1988 and published by the National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA).
How NAD 1983 changed from NAD 1927: - CA_7 (Los Angeles County) was combined with CA_5. - Michigan changed its zones, MI_W, MI_C, and MI_E that use the Transverse Mercator projection, to MI_N, MI_C, and MI_S that use the Lambert Conformal Conic projection. SPCS1927 shows the old zones even though they aren't strictly NAD 1927. - The three Montana zones were combined into one. - The two Nebraska zones were combined into one. - The two South Carolina zones were combined into one. - Valencia County in New Mexico is in NM_W for NAD 1927, but in NM_C for NAD 1983. - Part of Grant County in Washington was changed from WA_S to WA_N.

The following steps were performed by ESRI for Data & Maps 2002: Removed independent city void areas in Virginia.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Downloaded the ArcView GIS Shapefile, spcs_zone.zip, from http://www.esri.com/data/online/esri/datapacks/stateplane.html and extracted it. Removed unneeded attributes. Converted to North American Datum of 1983 (NAD83) by splitting the United States into Alaska, Hawaii, and the 48 contiguous states (including District of Columbia); converting each to NAD83; then merging them together. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr). Created projection file (.prj). Ran ArcView GIS Avenue request ExportClean, and created spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Added SQMI attribute and calculated its values.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Renamed attribute ZONENAME83 to ZONE. Renamed FIPSZONE83 to FIPSZONE. Added attribute ZONENAME and calculated its values with the descriptions of attribute ZONE. Added attribute COLORMAP and calculated its values from 1 to 5.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent areas for the State Plane Coordinate System zones for the 1983 North American Datum within United States.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The name of the zone. Note: Grant county, Washington is split into WA_N and WA_S zones.
attr.attrdefs: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (U.S. Coast and Geodetic Survey)

codesetd.codesets: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (U.S. Coast and Geodetic Survey)

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code for the zone.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The measure of area in square miles.
The number allows the zone to be colored so zones of the same color don't touch.
